page.title: 17ST GILES CHURCH MERSTON
page.content: This small church dates from the 13th. century, the chancel and nave are of this period, the north aisle and the porch were added in the 14th. and 17th. century respectively. The altar table is oak with four turned legs dating from 17th. century. The font with its square basin is of 12th. century style. The bell cote is modern and of stone. The single bell is dated 1809 and was made in Whitechapel Foundry, London by T. Mears. In 1983 the parish was linked with N Mundham, its immediate neighbour, and along with Hunston these parishes share one vicar. Apart from special baptism, marriage or funeral services, this church is only used twice monthly - for evensong. At other times the parishioners travel to St. Stephen's in North Mundham.
